TEXT.TITLE: TAIWAN SETS 1987 CANADIAN WHEAT IMPORT TARGET
TEXT.BODY: The Taiwan Flour Mills Association will import 81,000 tonnes of wheat from Canada in calendar 1987, unchanged from the 1986 level, an association spokesman told Reuters. He said the total will be delivered in three shipments. The first will be shipped to Taiwan between March 20 and April 20 and the other two will be made later this year, he said. The total wheat import target this year has been set at 700,000 tonnes, down from actual imports of 758,770 last year. Most of Taiwan's wheat imports come from the U.S., The spokesman said. REUTER
